div.bibl: Die Abendpost, Oct. 28, 1890. CONCERNING OUR INSTITUTION FOR THE INSANE AND POOR HOUSES.

body.p: Mr. F. H. Wines, Secretary of the State Supervision Office for Charities, is writing at present the recollections of his impressions, while inspecting all public institutions for the sick and disabled in Cook Country. Mr. Wines is of the opinion, that all institutions are overcrowded and employees there are corrupted. He is blaming political protection for the deplorable conditions.
